{{also|具体}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=具体}}

===Etymology===
{{rfe|lang=zh|Japanese sources list this as coming from Mencius.  C.f. http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E3%81%90%E3%81%9F%E3%81%84}}
Attestable in ancient Chinese texts. Used in {{w|Mencius}}'s writings with a meaning close to the literal sense, ''the entirety is arranged, in order''. Re{{borrowing|zh|ja|-|nocap=1}} {{ja-r|具体|ぐたい}}, which was repurposed in the 1881 work {{lang|ja|哲学字彙}} (''Tetsugaku Jii'', “Dictionary of Philosophy”) by {{w|Inoue Tetsujirō}} as a translation of the {{etyl|en|-}} term {{m|en|concrete}}, as opposed to {{m|en|abstract}}.
